H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3898.def: = action by which humans ingest food

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H7915.def: = small blade with a handle, ► used for cutting

H3930.def: = the front part of the neck

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H8376.def: = causative action by which someone draws an imaginary line from one location to the other

H4303.def: = food of a high quality and with a delicious taste

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H3577.def: = state in which something that has been said is not truthful

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H2308.def: = process by which objects stop existing in this world

H5774.def: = process by which an object moves through the air

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3671.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

H5404.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H3898.def: = action by which humans ingest food

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H8376.def: = causative action by which someone draws an imaginary line from one location to the other

H4303.def: = food of a high quality and with a delicious taste

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H8176.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H6958.def: = action by which humans or animals empty their stomachs of its contents; ◄ after having eaten too much, having ingested contaminated food, or due to sickness or excessive alcohol consumption

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H5273.def: = state in which a person or object has qualities that inspire love and appreciation

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H936.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H4405.def: used in poetry only; = a single distinct meaningful element of speech or writing, used to form sentences with others

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H1366.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H2389.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4513.def: = action by which humans or deities are unwilling to give or sell something to (other) humans

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2449.def: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H3629.def: = either of a pair of relatively small organs in the abdominal cavity of humans and animals; ≈ regarded as a delicacy and usually burned along with the fat of an animal sacrifice on the altar; considered the seat of emotions and one's devotion to God; in its literal sense only used for animals

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H4339.def: = state in which an object has a relativedly flat surface, where people and objects can move without obstacles; ≈ associated with security and prosperity

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7065.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H2400.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a specified or implied offence, ► which results in a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H2449.def: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H833.def: literally: to go forward on a road; hence: = to behave in a certain way

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

14.gl: to guide (one's heart) along the (right) road > to think right

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H2151.def: = state in which humans have the habit of ingesting more food than enough or appropriate; ≈ regarded as despicable and shameful behavior

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H2151.def: = state in which humans have the habit of ingesting more food than enough or appropriate; ≈ regarded as despicable and shameful behavior

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H5124.def: = state in which humans or animals are in a state of a relatively light sleep; ≈ sometimes with being inactive

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H7168.def: = pieces of cloth that have been torn

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H936.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H2204.def: = state in which humans are advanced in age, ≈ and the body is no longer able to function as before

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H4376.def: = causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H1523.def: mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H1523.def: mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7521.def: = state in which an animal or its meat is acceptable to God as sacrifice

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7745.def: = hole in the ground; ◄ either natural or dug by humans; ► can be used to trap animals; ≈ associated with danger

H5237.def: = state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective

H875.def: = hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄  usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally-occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded  as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life

H2863.def: = someone who takes away someone else's possessions against that person's will

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H693.def: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H4066.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H6482.def: = area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by accident or aggression; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances

H2448.def: = condition of eyeball tinged with blood; ◄ usually the result of drinking much wine; ≈ not necessarily seen as something bad

H309.def: = process by which an event happens later than expected

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H2713.def: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully

H4469.def: = {L:wine<SDBH:יַיִן>} mixed with water or spices; ► used as beverage, but also as sacrifice

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H119.def: = state in which an object is red or reddish in color; ≈ often associated with beauty

H3599.def: = receptacle, ◄ made of leather or cloth, ► used to carry possessions, including money

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4339.def: = state in which an object has a relativedly flat surface, where people and objects can move without obstacles; ≈ associated with security and prosperity

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H5391.def: = action by which a person or animal uses teeth to cut into something, like another person or animal

H5175.def: = long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching

H6567.def: = causative action by which humans or deities give information to (other) humans in a clear and understandable way

H6848.def: = extremely poisonous snake with the ability to spread the ribs in the neck area so as to form a broad, flat profile; dark brown in color with a yellowish underside (and sometimes yellowish bands); ◄ Desert Cobra (|iWalterinnesia aegyptia|i*) or Egyptian Cobra (|iNaja haje|i*); ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression and lurking danger

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H8419.def: literally: crookedness; hence: = state in which humans cannot be trusted to do the right thing or make the right choices in life

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H2260.def: = long wooden pole; ◄ part of a ship; ► functions as support of sail(s)

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H1986.def: = action by which humans or animals deliver a blow to an object with their hands, whether or not with the help of an instrument such as a {L:hammer<SDBH:הַלְמוּת>}, or with their feet

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities
